input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter which is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is SCOMActor

This wrapper resolves a set of the specified alerts.
Sample Item XML:
<items> <item> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> <command-parameters> <alert> <alert-search-criteria> <criteria-expression> <key>Id</key> <value>4be8166b-2444-454e-9f81-534b7508f585</value> <operator>equals</operator> </criteria-expression> </alert-search-criteria> </alert> <comment> <resolve-alert-comment>Resolving the alerts.</resolve-alert-comment> </comment> <preview>true</preview> </command-parameters> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
timeout-secs[Optional] Time in seconds after which the request will time-out of not completed. Default is: 60 secs
command-parameters[Required] This is the parent tag that contains actual parameters required to execute this particular operation.
alert[Required] This tag contains the alert search criteria information to find the set of alerts that will be resolved.
alert-search-criteria[Optional] This is the parent tag for defining the search criteria.
Following tags are only required if alert-search-criteria is provided by user criteria-expression[Required] This is the parent tag which contains details that make up a single search criteria. Multiple 'criteria-expression' tags can be provided under 'alert-search-criteria'.
key[Required] This tag contains the alert attribute by which the alerts are filtered. Valid values for this tag can be any of the alert attributes such as: name, description, id etc. You can use Find Alert By ID to get the list of all the alert attributes.
value[Required] This tag contains the valid search expression for the attribute specified in the key. Please refer to Criteria guide for valid search criteria expression format. NOTE: For help on writing regular expressions refer to 'Regular Expressions Guide.doc'
operator[Required] The 'operator' tag specified under 'alert-search-criteria' tag specifies the operand between multiple 'criteria-expression' tags. Valid values - and, or
The 'operator' tag specified under 'criteria-expression specifies the operand for key and value specified. Valid values - equals, not equals, like, in,greater than,less than NOTE: 'in' operator should only be used when 'Id' is used as key
resolve-alert-comment[Optional] Any comment to be provided while resolving the alert
preview[Optional] This tag indicates that user wants to preview the operation. Valid values - true Indicates that preview the result of the operation false Operation is executed without previewing the result of the execution Default value - false
